intro: Alyssopsis drumondii, commonly known as Drummond's alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of individual flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its fragrant, white to pale yellow blossoms. Alyssopsis drumondii is perennial, with slender, branched stems and small, linear leaves. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
